description: Dive into "Frankfurt's Picture-Perfect Gems Await" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Frankfurt's Picture-Perfect Gems Await

places.generalDescription: R√∂merberg, located in the heart of Frankfurt's old town, is a charming and irregularly shaped square adorned with reconstructed timber houses, a Gothic church, and the iconic fountain of justice at its center. This picturesque public square is the busiest pedestrian zone in the city and home to various tourist attractions, entertainment venues, Christmas markets, and other events. Visitors can explore the Historical Museum and marvel at the historic buildings such as Romer and Neues Rathaus.

sources.snippet: While you are in Frankfurt, you can‚Äôt miss the main tourist attraction in the city, the Historic Old Centre or Altstadt. This is a reconstructed Old Town, which after being badly destroyed during World War II aims to match the largest timber frame town in Germany that once existed here. The old-fashioned charming picturesque square in the city is surrounded by photogenic medieval houses, a church, and few historic administrative buildings.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to See and Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: Dann nehmen wir die erste Stra√üe links und gehen √ºber die Liebfrauenstra√üe, die in die Neue Kr√§me √ºbergeht. Der R√∂mer ist bereits seit 1405 der Sitz des Rathauses der Stadt und liegt am sogenannten R√∂merberg ‚Äì einem gro√üen Platz, der das Herz der Altstadt ist und auf dem zahlreiche Veranstaltungen stattfinden. Hier befindet sich zum Beispiel w√§hrend der Adventszeit der Weihnachtsbaum Frankfurts und das Zentrum des Weihnachtsmarktes.
sources.shortName: Frankfurt Fotospots ‚Äì 11 Instagram-Spots in Mainhattan

sources.snippet: Shoot The R√∂merberg And The New Old Town**A historical backdrop awaits you in the reconstructed Altstadt (Old Town), which, like most of the city, was rebuilt after damage in World War II. R√∂merberg is a square in the Old Town, which, come the end of the year, hosts an annual Christmas market. Even if you don‚Äôt visit at that time, you‚Äôll find plenty to capture through the year, including the half-timbered row houses.
sources.shortName: Don‚Äôt Miss The Most Instagrammable Spots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: At the heart of Frankfurt's Old Town, Romerberg is a historic square surrounded by medieval buildings. The iconic Romer, a medieval building with a stepped gable, serves as a captivating focal point. Capture the charm of this square, especially during festivals and events.
sources.shortName: One Week In Wiesbaden and Frankfurt Germany - 9 Best Photo Spots

sources.snippet: Like many central squares in Europe, Romerberg has many cafes, restaurants, souvenir shops and bars. While it may be touristy, it‚Äôs a great place to grab a schnitzel. The River Main is very close, and you can explore the riverside parks as well.
sources.shortName: 17 Cool Things to do in Frankfurt

places.name: R√∂merberg

reviews.text: I visited R√∂merberg in Frankfurt and loved it! The historic square is charming, with beautiful old buildings and a lively atmosphere. It was a perfect spot to walk around, take photos, and enjoy the city's history.

Old buildings were restored after they were destroyed during the war, this place is quite beautiful. There are ample of restaurants to sip a beer outdoor. Architecturally it tries to mimic the old town. Walk along this place is quite interesting

Loved this square, very pretty (even with some of it being under repair). Smaller than I expected but lovely restaurants and bars, souvenir shops and a stunning town hall where we witnessed several wedding celebrations during our time visiting.

places.generalDescription: Palmengarten Frankfurt is a sprawling botanical garden established in the 19th century, featuring an impressive collection of palm and orchid species showcased within its greenhouses. This renowned attraction is part of the must-see sights and activities in Frankfurt, alongside other landmarks such as Romerberg, Stadel Museum, and Frankfurt Zoo. Visitors can also explore local culture through dining options and budget-friendly accommodations while indulging in shopping experiences at Zeil Shopping District or enjoying vibrant nightlife scenes.

sources.snippet: Opened in 1871, Frankfurt‚Äôs botanical garden sweeps across 22 hectares, where plant species from all parts of the globe are displayed in greenhouses or the open-air. The specimens are organised according to their region: One glass pavilion contains a sub-Arctic landscape, while there‚Äôs a tropicarium for rainforest and two separate structures for the desert environment. Some of these are from the 1980s while others go back to the 19th century and were restored after the park was returned to the city‚Äôs hands in the 1960s.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: A few spots I loved and would recommend including in your itinerary if you visit Frankfurt: the Eiserner Steg (Iron Bridge) and its love locks, the Palmengarten with plants from all over the world and its pretty little cafe, the Kaiserdom i.e. Frankfurt‚Äôs red-sandstone cathedral, a stroll alongside the glittering river of Main and the beautiful Alte Oper. I‚Äôve been also told that the views from Main Tower are impressive which I intend to check out on my next visit, hopefully very soon!
sources.shortName: POSTCARDS FROM FRANKFURT

sources.snippet: Why it‚Äôs awesome: Being in a big city like Frankfurt is great, but after a couple of days you might start to get cabin fever and feel the need for some nature and fresh air. Well, Palmengarten gives you that without having to even leave the city limits!. The 22 hectare botanical garden is the biggest of three in Frankfurt (the others are Botanischer Garten and Tropicarium) and it‚Äôs the best place to see trees, plants, and flowers from a variety of climate zones.
sources.shortName: 10 BEST Places to Visit in Frankfurt (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: Home to 13,000 subtropical and tropical species, The Tropicarium Greenhouse at PalmenGarten is sure to add some colour to your feed. Designed by Gustav Schoser, Tropicarium consists of seven large and six small greenhouse units which reflect the waterlilies in a nearby pond. There are ten different tropical climatic-vegetation zones to explore here, each divide plants into groups according to their natural habitats, from arid to humid tropics.
sources.shortName: Things To See In Frankfurt For Best Instagram Spots

sources.snippet: The Palmengarten botanical garden is a green oasis that provides space for recreation and it is one of the most popular excursion destinations. It‚Äôs the ideal spot for a picnic or to take a rowing boat out on the lake. But the Palmengarten is also a mecca for photographers, offering countless photo opportunities, so it can be included among the best Frankfurt Instagram Spots!
sources.shortName: Best Frankfurt Instagram Spots
Discover Frankfurt'S Most Photogenic Spots With A Local

places.name: Palmengarten Frankfurt

reviews.text: I visited the Palmengarten in Frankfurt am Main today üåø Such a peaceful oasis in the city. I really enjoyed wandering through the diverse plant collections, enjoying the lush greenery and the little hidden gems such as the charming ponds with fountains. The vibrant colors of the flowers were a delight and it was the perfect escape to connect with nature ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Beautiful garden, it's so soothing to walk here.
Families with kids, couples and groups enjoyed the mood.
Next time we'll visit them on weekdays because the crowd was huge.
We anticipated amazing butterflies but there weren't many.

It is hard to describe the vibrant diversity of Palmengarten in Frankfurt. From the elegant glasshouse entrance to the lush tropical blooms, vivid cacti, and meticulously arranged flower beds, each image highlights the garden's rich botanical variety and serene atmosphere. A perfect visual journey through nature's beauty!

places.address: Palmengarten der Stadt, Siesmayerstra√üe 63, 60323 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

places.generalDescription: Alte Oper is a historic opera house in Frankfurt, originally opened in 1880 and reconstructed after World War II. It offers classical concert programs and stands as one of the city's cultural landmarks alongside other attractions like Romerberg, Romer, Archaeological Museum & Garden, and Frankfurt Cathedral. The city also boasts a vibrant cultural scene with venues such as Schirn Kunsthalle and the German Architecture Museum.

sources.snippet: An 1880 building designed by architect Richard Lucae, the Alte Oper Frankfurt was one of the most celebrated opera houses in the world until World War II left it a ruin. It wasn‚Äôt until 1981 that the much-loved building once again opened its doors to receive the city‚Äôs cultural elite, returned to former glory thanks to extensive fundraising efforts. Today the opera house and concert hall attracts some 475,000 visitors to around 450 cultural events a year.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Frankfurt for Photo Inspo

sources.snippet: Ich mochte die Alte Oper irgendwie schon immer‚Ä¶ Mit ihrem Spruch an der Fassade ‚ÄûDem Wahren, Sch√∂nen, Guten‚Äú hat sie mein K√ºnstlerherz bereits als Teenie erreicht und der Baustil der Neorenaissance hat mich schon immer an Geb√§ude aus meiner zweiten Heimat Italien erinnert. Es wurde 1880 eingeweiht und diente den Frankfurtern und seinen G√§sten bis 1944 als Opern- und Schauspielhaus. Nach der Zerst√∂rung im Zweiten Weltkrieg kam der Umzug in einen modernen Bau: Das Schauspielhaus.
sources.shortName: Frankfurt Fotospots ‚Äì 11 Instagram-Spots in Mainhattan

sources.snippet: Die Alte Oper Frankfurt war eines der ber√ºhmtesten Opernh√§user der Welt, bis der Zweite Weltkrieg sie als Ruine zur√ºcklie√ü. Beim Wiederaufbau wurden viele der urspr√ºnglichen Dekorationen, Reliefs, Medaillons, Fresken, Kacheln und Mosaike wiederhergestellt ‚Äì alles wundersch√∂ne Details, die du f√ºr dein Instagram einfangen kannst. Wenn du Frankfurt im Fr√ºhling besuchst, kannst du die Kirschbl√ºten-Allee neben der Alten Oper Frankfurt einfangen.
sources.shortName: Die Besten Instagram Spots Frankfurts

sources.snippet: Nat√ºrlich darf bei einer Fototour durch Frankfurt die Alte Oper nicht fehlen. Diese wurde im Zweiten Weltkrieg zerst√∂rt, jedoch achtete man beim Wiederaufbau darauf, viele der urspr√ºnglichen Dekorationen, Reliefs, Medaillons, Fresken, Kacheln und Mosaike wieder in ihrem urspr√ºnglichem Glanz erstrahlen zu lassen. Wenn du im Fr√ºhling hier bist, solltest du unbedingt die bl√ºhenden Kirschb√§ume in dein Foto mit einbeziehen.
sources.shortName: Die 14 besten Fotospots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: Why it‚Äôs awesome: No music lover can come to Frankfurt and leave out a visit to the incredible Alte Oper, one of the most prestigious music halls not only in Germany but the whole of Europe. The concert hall dates back to 1880, but like much of Frankfurt, it was destroyed by bombings in the Second World War. It was rebuilt in the 1970s before being reopening once again in 1981.
sources.shortName: 10 BEST Places to Visit in Frankfurt (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: Gehst du die Neue Mainzer Stra√üe weiter Richtung Norden, gelangst du nach ein paar Minuten an einem weiteren Frankfurter Wahrzeichen vorbei, das noch dazu einer der besten Fotospots in Frankfurt ist: die Alte Oper. Die Alte Oper dient dir das ganze Jahr √ºber als wundersch√∂nes Fotomotiv. Abends ist sie zudem sch√∂n beleuchtet, es lohnt sich also der mehrmalige Besuch.
sources.shortName: Die besten Fotospots in Frankfurt (inkl. Tipps & Adressen

sources.snippet: Add A Note Of Music To Your ‚ÄôGramWith beautiful bas-reliefs, medallions, frescoes, tiles and mosaics, the Alte Oper Frankfurt (main image) is made for social media. In Spring, you can capture the cherry blossom avenue next to the concert hall, and Frankfurt‚Äôs fashionable, stylish Goethestrasse is just steps away.
sources.shortName: Don‚Äôt Miss The Most Instagrammable Spots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: Alte Oper (Old Opera House) in Frankfurt is a favorite photo spot for photoshoots, cherished for its timeless beauty, architectural grandeur, and cultural significance. Here are five reasons why the Alte Oper stands out as a favored destination for capturing stunning images:
sources.shortName: Old Opera House & Other Top Photo Spots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: Frankfurt‚Äôs red-sandstone cathedral, a stroll alongside the glittering river of Main and the beautiful Alte Oper. I‚Äôve been also told that the views from Main Tower are impressive which I intend to check out on my next visit, hopefully very soon!
sources.shortName: POSTCARDS FROM FRANKFURT

places.name: Alte Oper

reviews.text:
Visiting the Old Opera House in Frankfurt was truly a magical experience. As I approached the building, I was immediately struck by its grand architecture ‚Äì the intricate details, the grand columns, and the way it majestically stands against the modern skyline. It felt like stepping back in time to an era of elegance and classical beauty.

Inside, the atmosphere was equally enchanting. The acoustics were incredible, and whether it's a concert or just a casual visit, the ambiance transports you to a world of music and art. I couldn't help but admire the beautiful chandeliers and classic interior design, which add to the timeless charm of the place.

Overall, the Old Opera House is a must-see in Frankfurt, whether you're an opera enthusiast or simply looking to experience a piece of the city's cultural heritage. I highly recommend adding it to your itinerary!

First time entering this gorgeous building and it didn't disappoint. The staff were friendly and available , the auditorium spacious and acoustically good.  You do need to take out a bank loan for a drink at the interval but all in all a great place for a show

went to the concert that premiered Luca Francesconi's Sospeso:

the first half is basically elderly abuse from the composer and whoever decided the program. It's a 11AM concert, who do you think will be there? Just bcuz elderly's eardrums are worn doesn't mean you can torture them with nail-scratching-the-blackboard sounds. And the worst thing is, i paid for it with my own will. Is that how middle classes should be punished? The composer is also a genuis in a way that he somehow found out the most abhorrent notes those instruments can play.

Also you need to pay for the program brochure. The grand concert hall, situated in the 2nd richest city in Europe, I believe has recently been taken over by the mngt staff from Ryanair.

Stars go to the fancy architecture and nice interior and Claire Huangci's performance in the second half.

places.generalDescription: The St√§del Museum is a renowned art gallery in Frankfurt, Germany, featuring an extensive collection of European art from the Middle Ages to the present day. It is one of the must-see attractions in the city, offering visitors a journey through seven centuries of artistic expression. In addition to St√§del, Frankfurt boasts other cultural institutions such as MMK for modern art, Liebighaus for sculpture, and Schirn for modern and contemporary exhibitions.

sources.snippet: A post shared by Saskia (@strassen_ninja) on Apr 2, 2018 at 7:39am PDT. A verdant green lawn punctuated with porthole skylights draws light into a subterranean extension at the Staedelmuesum, Frankfurt‚Äôs citizen‚Äôs museum. Completed by architecture firm Schneider + Schumacher in 2012, the extension doubled the museum in size, adding 3,000 square meters of light-flooded exhibition space for a collection of European art history spanning 700 years, from the early fourteenth century to the present.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Frankfurt for Photo Inspo

sources.snippet: One of Germany‚Äôs top cultural attractions, the St√§del Museum has recently been named German Museum of the Year following an extension for contemporary art in 2012. The museum was founded in 1815 when the banker Johann Friedrich St√§del donated an invaluable collection of old masters to the city. The current museum building was designed in a palatial Gr√ºnderzeit style in 1878 and within there‚Äôs a marvellous array of painting from the 1300s to the present.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet:
Das St√§delmuseum ist eine der Top-Attraktionen der Mainmetropole. Innen bietet es die Heimat der Alten Meister, der weltber√ºhmten Impressioniesten
 oder auch der Modernen K√ºnstler. Im St√§delmuseum sind sogar die Aufg√§nge eine Aufnahme wert.
sources.shortName: Frankfurts Top 10 Instagram-Spots

places.name: St√§del Museum

reviews.text:
A beautiful museum in Frankfurt! üé®

I really enjoyed my visit to the St√§del Museum. It has many amazing paintings and artworks , from old masters like Rembrandt and Vermeer to modern artists. The museum is big but easy to walk through, and everything is well organized.

It is nice museum with multiple floors,  famous art, and contemporary selections as well. We have spent the whole day.  Toilets are nice and clean. The person at the first place before stairs was very informative and friendly üíêüëçüòÄ. Lockers are nice and have 1 or 2 ‚Ç¨ deposit. Roof top was nice. Strongly recommend seeing this museum üëå.  It is a bit expensive though, 16 ‚Ç¨ per person.

this is definitely a museum that you should take the time to see. They have three floors a various artist and art. It's quite pricey. It's ‚Ç¨18 per person which I find expensive.  entrance. People at the cashier were very nice. They were helpful. They also have bathrooms which were very clean a gift shop they also had a small caf√© with a lovely young lady behind it who could speak English I'm always happy when that happens since I don't speak German and I ordered a piece of the apple pie which she recommended and it was delicious and a cup of cappuccino.  It's a nice way to spend 2 to 3 hours enjoying the beautiful art.

places.generalDescription: Frankfurt Cathedral, also known as Kaiserdom, is a stunning Gothic-style Catholic cathedral that boasts Renaissance frescoes and offers panoramic city views from its tower. It was once the tallest building in the city until skyscrapers like the Main Tower and Commerzbank Tower surpassed it. Dedicated to St. Bartholomew, this Roman Catholic church played a significant role in the Holy Roman Empire's elections and coronations.

sources.snippet: Why it‚Äôs awesome: The Gothic Frankfurt Cathedral is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city and it‚Äôs certainly worth setting aside a little time to visit. It‚Äôs also known as the Kaiserdom and was the tallest building in the city until the 1950s, when the skyscrapers from like the Main Tower and Commerzbank Tower (the 7 th tallest building in Europe) overtook it. This Roman Catholic church is dedicated to St. Bartholomew and it was one of the most important buildings to the Holy Roman Empire, as it was dedicated to the empire‚Äôs elections and coronations.
sources.shortName: 10 BEST Places to Visit in Frankfurt (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: When Germany was united in the 19th century, Frankfurt Cathedral took on special meaning because of its historical importance in the days of the Holy Roman Empire. The cathedral was begun in the 1300s and 1400s in the Gothic style, and has been faithfully rebuilt twice: Once after a fire in 1867 and then in the 1950s after the war. This former collegiate church was awarded the title of ‚Äúcathedral‚Äù in 1562 when it started hosting the coronation ceremonies for the Holy Roman Kings.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: Frankfurt Cathedral, or Frankfurter Dom, is a medieval masterpiece that dominates the city's skyline with its impressive Gothic architecture and towering spires. Dating back to the 14th century, the cathedral serves as a historic and cultural landmark, inviting visitors to explore its rich religious history and enjoy panoramic views of Frankfurt from its observation platform. Due to time constraint, we didn‚Äôt go to the platform.
sources.shortName: One Week In Wiesbaden and Frankfurt Germany - 9 Best Photo Spots

sources.snippet: A Gothic beauty, Frankfurt Cathedral is a gem in its own right and deserves a snap and a wander inside. While making the rounds, you can notice another important religious building to visit in this city, St. Paul‚Äôs on Paulsplatz. It‚Äôs a building of great importance, not just for Frankfurt but for Germany as a nation.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to See and Do in Frankfurt (Germany)
Frankfurt Instagram Photo Locations - the Best Places for Skyline Photos

places.name: Frankfurt Cathedral

reviews.text: I'm not really into cathedrals or churches, but this one was really beautiful. The Gothic style really matched my style. Really nice work with rebuilding it after World War II. Even with many people you didn't have to wait to go inside. Definitely recommend that one.

Beautiful cathedral. Really enjoyed the experience. I went to the top of the tower, the staircase is really narrow steep and long so be prepared for a bit of a hike but once you are at the top it's a full 360¬∞ view of the city. The price was quite reasonable I believe it was ‚Ç¨5 per person but I could be mistaken. 10/10 if in Frankfurt this is a great place to go. There's also lots of historical buildings in the vicinity including places to eat or grab coffee. Great place to spend an afternoon.

recently visited Frankfurt's main square and it was an unforgettable experience. The beautiful historic buildings create such a charming atmosphere, taking you back in time with their unique architecture. What truly amazed me was the sound of the church bells ‚Äì so powerful and mesmerizing that it filled the whole square with a magical feeling. I even recorded a video to capture the moment, but being there in person was beyond compare. A must-visit spot in Frankfurt, full of history, beauty, and soul.

places.generalDescription: The Iron Footbridge, also known as Eiserner Steg, is a historic landmark in Frankfurt that offers stunning city views and is adorned with padlocks left by romantic couples. This wrought iron bridge was originally designed by Peter Schmick and constructed in 1868, connecting the Romerberg at Sachsenhausen neighborhood. Despite undergoing reconstructions over the years, it has maintained its original design.

sources.snippet: The featured shot is from the Alte Br√ºcke (Old Main Bridge) looking west towards the Eiserner Steg (Iron Footbridge). The footbridge is a relative newcomer, being only about 145 years old with its fundamental structure still intact, while the Old Main Bridge site has seen 18 re-builds of various bridge types over the centuries since it was first documented, in the year 1222.
sources.shortName: Frankfurt Bridges - Best Photo Spots

places.name: Iron Footbridge

reviews.text: This bridge is really cool, it is covered in love locks. It is pretty insane how some of these locks are all connected in ways I didn't even think was possible. The bridge also offers beautiful views of the skyline and is pedestrian only. I recommend!

Great place to take a walk. You can start with the bridge and then go through promenade. You can get there with an elevator, so it is accessible for people with disabilities. Really fine and pleasant view. You can also go sightseeing with a boat. Pretty cool place.

Eiserner Steg is an old iron bridge spreading across the Main river connecting Frankfurt old town with residential area on the southern bank.
It's a nice historic structure now only for pedestrian traffic. I strongly suggest crossing it as it offers terrific views of entire Frankfurt, both modern and old town. Likewise many such bridges there're many love locks along it

places.address: Eiserner Steg, 60311 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

places.generalDescription: Bethmann Park, a 3-hectare oasis nestled in the heart of the city, offers a serene escape for tourists and locals alike. Shielded from the urban hustle by thick walls, this park exudes tranquility with its lush floral displays and peaceful ambiance. The highlight of the park is its renowned Chinese Garden, designed according to feng-shui principles.

sources.snippet: Capture Peace At Bethmannpark**The oasis of calm that can be found in the former garden of the Bethmann banking family is partly due to its being shielded from the sounds of hectic city traffic by thick walls. Bethmannpark is like a small spa park with its diverse blossoms, lush flower beds and all-pervading tranquillity. The Chinese garden, along with its pond, small bridge and a step portal decorated with dragons is the perfect place to capture shots to populate your grid.
sources.shortName: Don‚Äôt Miss The Most Instagrammable Spots in Frankfurt

places.name: Bethmann Park

reviews.text: Amazing little Park in the middle of a busy City. Like a little Oasis. In the Spring and Summer a colorful place as well. Good for kids and grown-ups to calm down a bit.
Beautiful place, i went there in May 2025, it was cold weather. The park is quite beautiful with lovely flowers.
A cool park in the middle of the city full of plants, and further down lies a Chinese garden with statues and all sorts of oriental motifs.

places.address: Friedberger Landstra√üe 8, 60316 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

places.generalDescription: Gr√ºneburg Park, situated in Frankfurt, Germany, was once part of the expansive Rothschild family estate. This 29-acre park features open-air theatre, a Korean Garden, and lush greenery. The landscape is adorned with sprawling lawns and intersecting paths ideal for jogging and cycling. Families and couples often gather here for picnics on the grassy expanses. The Schonhof pavilion at the heart of the park houses a charming caf√© offering refreshments to visitors.

sources.snippet: Between the Goethe University and the Palmengarten is one of Frankfurt‚Äôs favourite spots to meet up, hang out and relax. When the weather‚Äôs good the Gr√ºneburgpark‚Äôs endless lawns are decked with groups of students from the university, and families on days out. The 30-hectare English-style park was designed in 1877 on land that once belonged to the Rothschild family.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: Named for a green castle that stood here in the 14th century, Gr√ºneburgpark is now a park designed in the English garden style.
sources.shortName: 17 Cool Things to do in Frankfurt

places.name: Gr√ºneburg park

reviews.text: Gr√ºneburgpark in Augsburg is a hidden gem, offering a peaceful escape within the city. This small, well-maintained park features lush lawns, mature trees, and a charming pond, perfect for a leisurely stroll or a quiet picnic. Its tranquil atmosphere makes it an ideal spot to unwind, enjoy nature, and take a break from the urban hustle. Though not large or bustling, Gr√ºneburgpark's simplicity and serene beauty make it a favorite among locals looking for a quiet retreat.

Definitely one of the nicest parks in Frankfurt! Being a blanket and some friends, walk your dog, join a sports group, go for a run, hang out with other parents by the playground :)
Gets a bit loud and wild on the weekends, and it helps to like humans as the nearby university brings quite a few of them :) there's also a fenced in dog area and some nice quiet corners to find. If you dare, come during sundowns around summer solstice where the fireflies migrate here from the neighboring botanical garden to work their magic on you ;)
Amazing clean and nice park for relaxing, running and also has several children's playgrounds.

places.generalDescription: MyZeil is a large shopping mall in the heart of Frankfurt, known for its unique and contemporary architecture. Designed by Roman architect Massimiliano Fuksas, the mall's mostly transparent shell features a fluid shape inspired by a river, creating an undulating roof that allows natural light to illuminate all six levels. Opened in 2009, MyZeil boasts a gigantic curved glass-and-steel facade housing 77,000 square meters of retail space.

sources.snippet: A post shared by George Spahr (@g.spahr) on Mar 30, 2018 at 8:34am PDT. Berlin has the Reichstag and Frankfurt has the MyZeil, when it comes to Germany‚Äôs dramatic glass buildings. Roman architect Massimiliano Fuksas was thinking about rivers when he designed the fluid shape of the shopping mall‚Äôs mostly transparent glass and steel shell, which plunges from an undulating roof to draw natural light throughout all six levels of retail space.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Frankfurt for Photo Inspo

sources.snippet:
Die einen lieben sie, die anderen hassen sie, wegen ihrer Architektur, die so gar nicht in die Frankfurter Innenstadt passt. Auch wenn die MyZeil Anlaufpunkt und Treffpunkt vieler Teenager ist,
 bietet sie f√ºr Instagramer zahlreiche au√üergew√∂hnliche Motive: die Rolltreppen, die zentrale Glasr√∂hre, die Spiegelungen und die verwinkelten Blicke aus einem der oberen Stockwerke. A photo posted by Martin Widenka
 (@widenka) on Jun 4, 2015 at 11:26pm PDT
sources.shortName: Frankfurts Top 10 Instagram-Spots

sources.snippet: Wenn es sich um die beeindruckendsten Glasbauten Deutschlands handelt, geht der Preis definitiv an das MyZeil, ein Einkaufszentrum im Zentrum von Frankfurt. Der r√∂mische Architekt Massimiliano Fuksas lie√ü sich beim Entwurf dieses Geb√§udes von Fl√ºssen inspirieren. Eine flie√üende Form, eine transparente H√ºlle aus Glas und Stahl, die von einem wellenf√∂rmigen Dach herabf√§llt, um nat√ºrliches Licht durch alle sechs Ebenen der Verkaufsfl√§chen zu leiten.
sources.shortName: Die Besten Instagram Spots Frankfurts

sources.snippet: Von der Neorenaissance zur Moderne: MyZeil ist ein relativ neues Einkaufszentrum (er√∂ffnet 2009) auf der beliebten Einkaufsmeile Zeil. Es hat sechs Stockwerke, die du entweder einzeln ansteuern kannst oder du f√§hrst mit der l√§ngsten innenliegenden und freitragenden Rolltreppe Europas (42 Meter) direkt bis nach oben. Ich glaube, mich erinnert das wellenf√∂rmige Glas an das Meer, wodurch mir das ganze Geb√§ude Ruhe und Kraft gibt.
sources.shortName: Frankfurt Fotospots ‚Äì 11 Instagram-Spots in Mainhattan

sources.snippet: Denn das Einkaufzentrum MyZeil bietet nicht nur Shops und Restaurants, sondern auch Architektur, die es zu fotografieren lohnt. Im Inneren findest du die l√§ngste innenliegende und freitragende Rolltreppe Europas (42 Meter). Schau einfach mal vorbei und halte die Augen offen, auf sechs Etagen verteilt gibt es den einen oder anderen Fotospot zu entdecken.
sources.shortName: Die 14 besten Fotospots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: Well, take a look: The building is made out of glass with a giant hole in the middle of it. It was designed by Roman architect Massimiliano Fuksas and is part of the PalaisQuartier development. It was officially opened in 2009 and also looks incredible from the inside, which is why we included a second photo of the MyZeil in this article.

places.name: MyZeil

reviews.text: MyZeil impresses with its futuristic design, diverse shops, and vibrant dining area. The long escalator is a highlight, though parking is pricey. A great spot for shopping and city views.
Really cool mall right in the heart of Frankfurt. Loved the design and the food court on the top floor. Great spot to shop, eat, or just hang out.

One of the most iconic shopping centers in Frankfurt, MyZeil stands out with its futuristic architecture and impressive glass fa√ßade. Inside, visitors can find a wide range of international and local brands, restaurants, and a panoramic escalator that adds to the unique experience. A must-visit for shopping lovers and architecture enthusiasts alike.

places.generalDescription: Established in 1858, Zoo Frankfurt is home to a diverse array of animal species thriving in naturalistic environments. The zoo is one of the top attractions in Frankfurt, alongside other popular sights like Romerberg, Stadel Museum, and Palmengarten. Visitors can immerse themselves in local culture and explore the city's vibrant restaurant scene.

sources.snippet: Germany‚Äôs second oldest zoo dates to 1858 and is open 365 days a year. The location is 11 hectares of landscaped parkland to the east of the Innenstadt. It‚Äôs all an environment for 4,500 animals from more than 500 different species.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

places.name: Zoo Frankfurt

reviews.text:
The zoo is very picturesque! Nicely decorated and great it is good for a weekend family activity.
Lots of different animals from all corners of earth, but don't expect to see them all since their enclosures are very big and they often hide.
The food is also great and I definitely recommend it!

The reptile and nocturnal houses were really cool! Coming from the United States there were a lot of animals I don't see very often in American zoos. It's small-ish in size but they really pack in a lot of animals without feeling like they're in small enclosures. We got here late in the day and spent about 2.5 hours here but we could've spent another hour or two.

What a fantastic day at the Frankfurt Zoo! A definite highlight for me was the penguin üêßüêßüêßüêß enclosure. They are so charming and fun to watch as they waddle around and swim gracefully in the water. The whole zoo is beautifully laid out with so many amazing animals to see. Highly recommend it for a perfect day out! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

places.generalDescription: The Main Eiserner Steg is a picturesque pedestrian bridge in Frankfurt, connecting the city center with the Sachsenhausen district. It offers a classic view of the city's skyline and is adorned with colorful love locks, adding a romantic touch to the scenery. Visitors can capture stunning sunset views and witness the city lights coming to life. The area around the bridge features old German-style houses and provides a great starting point for exploring Frankfurt's attractions.

sources.snippet: A post shared by Pascal Rnk (@pascalrnk) on Apr 1, 2018 at 11:57am PDT. All the bridges over the River Main make for an excellent photo-op, but an easy stroll from the R√∂mer is the neo-Gothic-style Eiserner Steg (Iron Bridge), an iron and concrete pedestrian bridge connecting the city center and R√∂merberg with Sachsenhausen on the southern banks of the Main River. Built in 1869 (and built again after World War II), the bridge‚Äôs curved iron arches are immortalized in several Expressionist paintings by German artist Max Beckmann.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Frankfurt for Photo Inspo

sources.snippet: Spanning the River Main between the centre of the city and the Sachsenhausen area, Frankfurt‚Äôs iron footbridge has had an eventful 150 years since it was completed in 1869. It has been rebuilt twice, the first time in 1912 when the Main was made navigable to larger boats, and again after the Nazis blew it up in the last days of the Second World War. There‚Äôs an elegance in the bridge‚Äôs metal frame, and the best time to cross is late in the day when the low sun illuminates the high-rise towers in the Bankenviertel.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: Der Eiserne Steg ist eine der bekanntesten Fu√üg√§ngerbr√ºcken der Stadt und eines der Wahrzeichen Frankfurts und verbindet den R√∂merberg (Innenstadt) mit dem Stadtteil Sachsenhausen auf der gegen√ºberliegenden Mainseite. Der Eiserne Steg ist nicht nur ein toller Fotospot in Frankfurt, um die Skyline zu fotografieren, sondern ist auch f√ºr sich gesehen ein wundervolles Fotomotiv. Die Br√ºcke aus Stahl und Beton ist sehr massiv und die Streben lassen sich auf unterschiedliche Weise interessant in deine Fotos einbauen.
sources.shortName: Die besten Fotospots in Frankfurt (inkl. Tipps & Adressen

sources.snippet: A few spots I loved and would recommend including in your itinerary if you visit Frankfurt: the Eiserner Steg (Iron Bridge) and its love locks, the Palmengarten with plants from all over the world and its pretty little cafe, the Kaiserdom i.e. Frankfurt‚Äôs red-sandstone cathedral, a stroll alongside the glittering river of Main and the beautiful Alte Oper. I‚Äôve been also told that the views from Main Tower are impressive which I intend to check out on my next visit, hopefully very soon!
sources.shortName: POSTCARDS FROM FRANKFURT

sources.snippet: Eiserner Steg is another perfect photo location in Frankfurt‚Äîthere‚Äôs a stunning skyline panorama and a lovely display of colourful love locks. This pedestrian bridge connects the city centre around R√∂merberg with the Sachsenhausen district on the other side of the river Main. Every day, thousands of people walk across this impressive bridge from Hibbdebach to Dribbdebach.
sources.shortName: Top 5 photo spots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: Auf Sightseeing-Tour in Frankfurt kommt man an dieser Attraktion nicht vorbei: Der Eiserne Steg ist eine imposante Fu√üg√§ngerbr√ºcke und verbindet die Altstadt und den Stadtteil Sachsenhausen. Jeden Tag spazieren etwa 10.000 Menschen √ºber die sch√∂nste Br√ºcke Frankfurts, um von einem Mainufer zum n√§chsten zu gelangen. Auch bei frisch Verliebten ist der Steg bliebt.
sources.shortName: Die Besten Instagram Spots Frankfurts

sources.snippet: One of the most famous bridges in Frankfurt is the Iron Bridge (Eiserner Steg). A german musican by the name of Philipp Poisel even wrote a song about the brige with the same title, which was used in a german movie called ‚ÄûWhat a Man‚Äú, which was filmed in Frankfurt. On the bridge, you will find many lovers locks.
sources.shortName: The best Photo Hotspots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: You can take great photos here in daylight, but it also looks cool at night. The complete bridge is well lighted. Since I wanted to take off this shot something from the typical FFM Instagram pictures, I photographed my iPhone, which looks super interesting by the depth of field in my opinion.
sources.shortName: Photo Spots in Frankfurt am Main

sources.snippet: Built in 1869, the bridge‚Äôs iron arches are included in many Expressionist paintings by German artist Max Beckmann. Two of my favourite shots are of the bridge and the skyline of the financial district. The Ultimate Guide Of Things To Do In Frankfurt

places.name: Holbeinsteg

reviews.text: Beautiful bridge for walking and biking in Frankfurt. Great views of city and river from here. Get beautiful pictures of river and city if you reach in the evening
Great views, you can feel vibrations when people are walking.

This is one of the bridges that spans the River Main in Frankfurt in between Friedensbr√ºcke (southwest) and Untermainbr√ºcke (northeast). It is constructed in 1990 as a suspension bridge for pedestrians and cyclists by architect Albert Speer & Co. and stretches 210 metres in total length and supported by A shaped pole towers on each end. There are fine views of the river and both banks from the Holbein Bridge. We enjoyed walking across while sightseeing in the area.

places.generalDescription: Lohrberg in Frankfurt is a popular leisure spot offering stunning city views and the last remaining vineyard in the area. Visitors can relax on picnic blankets or folding chairs while enjoying barbecues at the nearby Ostpark. The location also hosts live music concerts during fair weather. Additionally, Lohrberg features a small restaurant with outdoor seating, an apple orchard serving homemade apple juice and local cider, as well as amenities like a children's swimming pool and barbecue area.

sources.snippet: Hier oben auf dem Lohrberg, dem Hausberg der Frankfurter, erwartet euch nicht nur ein toller Ort f√ºr sommerliche Grillabende, auch den letzten Weinberg innerhalb des Stadtgebietes findet ihr hier oben. Auf dem Lohrberg offenbart sich au√üerdem eine der sch√∂nsten Aussichten auf die weltber√ºhmte Skyline ‚Äì und zwar ganz umsonst.
sources.shortName: Die Besten Instagram Spots Frankfurts

sources.snippet: Wir pers√∂nlich lieben gro√üartige Aussichten √ºber die St√§dte, die wir im Urlaub besuchen. Einen tollen Blick auf Frankfurt mit seinen Wolkenkratzern hast du vom Lohrberg aus. Bei einem entspannten Picknick kannst du an warmen Tagen den Blick auf die Skyline ganz entspannt genie√üen.
sources.shortName: Die 14 besten Fotospots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: Lohrberg, Frankfurt's local mountain, is the ideal spot for mild summer evenings. It‚Äôs an absolute must-see; you get a striking view of the city‚Äôs skyline and the Lohrberger Hang vineyards. Who‚Äôd expect to find vineyards in the Frankfurt municipal area?
sources.shortName: Top 5 photo spots in Frankfurt

sources.snippet: Frankfurt's local mountain is a very popular excursion destination. No wonder, as from here you have a really breathtaking view of the city. Especially good photo locations are the Lohrpark and the Lohrberger Hang.
sources.shortName: Get a picture of Frankfurt - The best photo hotspots

sources.snippet: The Lohrberg is Frankfurt‚Äôs local mountain and the only remaining vineyard within the city limits. It makes for the perfect spot to get a picture at, providing a beautiful view of the Frankfurt skyline.

places.name: Lohrberg (Frankfurt)

reviews.text:
Great spot to enjoy the good weather ‚òÄÔ∏è with the city views just 10 minutes away from Frankfurt, by car.
There is plenty of people with their own barbecues, people on the grass on a picnic blanket and there is a restaurant with nice outdoor sitting and a orchestra.
The restrooms are free and clean.
Such a peaceful and calming place to visit with your loved ones üòä

Frankfurt's only vineyard, Lohrberg demonstrates the city's viticultural history. Producing local Riesling, it highlights the region's microclimate, soil composition, and the continuation of wine production within an urban landscape.

places.generalDescription: Frankfurter R√∂mer is a medieval building that now serves as the town hall, featuring a stepped gable facade and adorned with numerous portraits. This historical site is just one of the many attractions in Frankfurt am Main, which also boasts landmarks like Romerberg (City Center), Archaeological Museum & Garden, Frankfurt Cathedral (Kaiserdom), and Stadel Museum.

sources.snippet: A post shared by Valentina¬© (@aimveee) on Mar 27, 2018 at 9:26am PDT. Click on hot Frankfurt hashtag #Frankfurtdubistsowunderbar (‚ÄúFrankfurt you are so wonderful‚Äù), and you‚Äôre sure to scroll through striking images of the R√∂mer (City Hall) and its distinctive tiered gabled roof. Office to the city‚Äôs mayor, this three-story building complex, now nine interconnected buildings, has served as Frankfurt‚Äôs main city hall for 600 years.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Frankfurt for Photo Inspo

sources.snippet: This three-story building complex has served as Frankfurt‚Äôs main city hall for 600 years. While sections date back to the Middle Ages, the R√∂mer was mostly destroyed during World War II. Today, it is home to the Frankfurt Christmas Market and makes for a great photo subject all year round.
sources.shortName: Things To See In Frankfurt For Best Instagram Spots

places.generalDescription: St. Paul's Church, also known as Paulskirche, is a significant redbrick church in Frankfurt that serves as a memorial to the beginning of German democracy. It has been repurposed to host concerts and exhibitions. The original construction began in 1789, coinciding with the French Revolution. The church was where the first freely-elected legislative body in Germany, the Frankfurter National Assembly, convened in 1849.

sources.snippet: On Paulsplatz, St Paul‚Äôs Church is a building of great significance, not just for Frankfurt but Germany as a nation. It began as a Lutheran church in 1789 and was designed with a circular plan according to the protestant principles of the time, ensuring that every member of the congregation could hear the sermon. In 1848 that round format made St Paul‚Äôs the ideal seat for the first democratically elected parliament in Germany.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)
17 Cool Things to do in Frankfurt

places.name: St. Paul's Church

reviews.text:
Another unmissable place in the heart of Frankfurt. A spot for the first German parliament I can recommend the church to be visited. On the lower floor is a very interesting digital exhibition about the history of the building. The main room, the planery hall  can be found on the upper floor.
No entrance fee, recommended to go for it!
From the outside the church looks really good, even tho kinda small. Sadly, I couldn't get inside, because the heavy rain complicated my plans. I wish I could.

St. Paul's Church in Frankfurt is a historically significant landmark renowned for its role in German democracy.  It is a former Protestant church used as a national assembly hall.

The church is particularly celebrated for hosting the first freely elected German parliament in 1848.

The church's neoclassical architecture, with its impressive circular nave and red sandstone facade, adds to its visual appeal. Inside, the spacious and serene interior provides a contemplative atmosphere. However the interior is very basic, so you could skip it unless you participating in some event.

places.generalDescription: The Westhafen Tower, also known as Ebbelwoi to locals, is a cylindrical glass office tower in Frankfurt. Its green-tinted exterior has earned it the nickname of "apple wine glass" due to its resemblance to the local beverage. Situated by the River Main and near Friedensbrucke and Westhafenbrucke, this 30-story building stands out with its stunning glass design that complements the surrounding architecture.

sources.snippet: Sometimes when you really like something you see it everywhere. Despite being green-tinted, the cylindrical glass Westhafen Tower recalls a nice tall glass of apple wine to Frankfurt‚Äôs locals. They call the 30-story office tower Ebbelwoi, the colloquial word for the state beverage‚Äîsomething not exactly intended by the building‚Äôs architects, Schneider + Schumacher.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Frankfurt for Photo Inspo

sources.snippet: On the Westhafen ‚ÄúEbbelwoi‚Äù Tower sit 3,500 glass triangles. They make the building highly reflective and very insta-worthy. If you are visiting during the summer, you‚Äôll notice that some of the triangles are revealed to be windows drawing cool breezes inside.
sources.shortName: Things To See In Frankfurt For Best Instagram Spots

places.name: Westhafen Tower

reviews.text:
Striking Architecture & Great Riverside Views ‚Äì A Modern Frankfurt Landmark

The Westhafen Tower is one of Frankfurt's most distinctive and eye-catching skyscrapers. With its cylindrical shape and diamond-patterned glass fa√ßade, it stands out beautifully against the skyline and adds a modern touch to the historic city.

Located along the Main River, it's a great place to enjoy a scenic walk or a riverside coffee. The area around the tower is clean, well-developed, and quieter than the city center, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed stroll or some peaceful time by the water.

While the building is mostly used for offices and isn't open to tourists inside, it's still a must-see from the outside for fans of contemporary architecture. At sunset, the way the glass reflects the changing sky is truly stunning - great for photography!

The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that public access is limited, and it would be amazing if there were an observation deck or caf√© open to the public inside the tower.

Tip: Walk a bit along the riverbank to capture the full tower with the Main River in the foreground - perfect photo op!

4/5 ‚Äì A modern architectural gem by the river. Worth a visit for the views and atmosphere, especially if you appreciate design and quieter corners of Frankfurt.

Sparkling tall glass tower right by the Friedensbrucke and  Westhafenbrucke - the tower's name translates to "West Port Tower", sits right by the River Main. This can be seen from afar while on the trails.
Stunning glass building, looks amazing in combination with the buildings on the shore

places.generalDescription: Located in the lively city of Frankfurt, Goethe House is the birthplace and childhood home of the renowned writer and politician Johann Wolfgang von Goethe. Visitors can take a tour of this historical house featuring period interiors and exhibitions. The house offers a glimpse into Goethe's life, allowing guests to explore the rooms where he wrote his famous works. The collection includes original manuscripts, artwork, and personal belongings.

sources.snippet: Continuing with the history and art theme, you can‚Äôt miss the opportunity to visit Goethe house when you are in Frankfurt. Situated at 23 Gro√üer Hirschgraben, (near to the city centre) this was the birthplace of the famous German writer Johann Wolfgang von Goethe and the residence of the Goethe family until 1795. After being damaged in World War II, the house was restored to as close as possible to what it looked like earlier when Goethe lived here, and also there is a museum attached to it, in case you want to know more about Johann Wolfgang von Goethe‚Äôs life and work.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to See and Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: Why it‚Äôs awesome: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe is probably the most famous German writer of all time. He was also a politician and wrote essays on horticulture and anatomy, so he was a pretty busy guy!. See the house where he grew up with his sister Cornelia, which has been lovingly preserved with period furniture and artwork from the Goethe area, exploring Goethe‚Äôs relationship with art of the time.
sources.shortName: 10 BEST Places to Visit in Frankfurt (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: The German polymath Johann Wolfgang von Goethe was born at the fine corbelled house on 23 Gro√üer Hirschgraben in 1749. It‚Äôs a medieval dwelling that had been updated with a Rococo facade and interior just before Goethe‚Äôs parents moved in. Goethe lived here until the age of 16 and returned for long spells in between stints studying in Leipzig and Strasbourg.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: Like many central squares in Europe, Romerberg has many cafes, restaurants, souvenir shops and bars. While it may be touristy, it‚Äôs a great place to grab a schnitzel. The River Main is very close, and you can explore the riverside parks as well.
sources.shortName: 17 Cool Things to do in Frankfurt

places.name: Goethe House

reviews.text:
If your trip takes you to Frankfurt, Goethe's house should be a must-stop for you. üòç

The museum is dedicated not only to Goethe but to romantics in general, the exhibition is excellent, interesting and very informative.

Goethe's house on four floors with original furniture, which is said to have had everything.

The house has been immaculately restored after war damage, and luckily the genuine contents had been stored away safely during the war. So you get a really good idea of life in a late eighteenth century rising middle class house. And a vertical piano!

One of the must-visit tourist attractions in Frankfurt because it offers a deep insight into the life and times of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe. Visitors can explore the rooms where Germany's most famous writer lived, see authentic furniture, and learn about his early inspirations. A great place for literature and history lovers.

places.address: Gro√üer Hirschgraben 23-25, 60311 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

places.generalDescription: Museumsufer, also known as the Museum Embankment, is a renowned cultural district in Frankfurt. In the 1980s, the city established this impressive boulevard of museums along the Stadel art museum. The area now features a collection of new and transformed historic buildings housing some of Germany's most significant museums. Visitors can explore a diverse range of institutions covering applied arts, architecture, film, Jewish history, and antique sculpture.

sources.snippet: Why it‚Äôs awesome: Along both sides of the River Main, you‚Äôll find this assortment of fantastic museums, centred around the St√§del Museum. Frankfurt‚Äôs museum embankment is not only one of the most important groups of museums in Germany, but the whole of Europe!. You can enter for free too so it‚Äôs a great place to check out if you‚Äôre travelling on a budget.
sources.shortName: 10 BEST Places to Visit in Frankfurt (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: Grouped together on both sides of the River Main is a cluster of 12 museums in an area known as the Museumsufer (Museum Embankment). Most are on the left bank (south side). There are museums for film, art, architecture, communication and ethnography, to name a handful, and we‚Äôll deal with many of them in more detail later.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

sources.snippet: If you want to get even more museum stuff, then Museumsufer is the only place to satisfy your desire in Frankfurt. It‚Äôs a cluster of 38 museums placed together on both sides of the River Main. These museums are mainly for film, art, architecture, communication, and ethnography.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to See and Do in Frankfurt (Germany)

places.name: Museumsufer

reviews.text: Frankfurt's skyline ‚Äì a perfect blend of tradition and modernity by the Main River.
A beautiful promenade near the river with several museums around, the cathedral is nearby, the old town, the bridges. Pretty much everything.  You'll often see people enjoying their time here

I spent time at Museumsufer in Frankfurt and really enjoyed it. The area along the river has so many interesting museums, and walking between them is really pleasant. It's a perfect spot for culture lovers and a relaxing day exploring art and history
